{"step_by_step_thinking": "Cobalt-Chromium alloys, as the name suggests, are primarily made up of cobalt and chromium. The exact percentages can vary, but typically, the cobalt content is higher than the chromium content. Therefore, the option with a higher percentage of cobalt would be the correct one. Palladium and gold are not typically components of Cobalt-Chromium alloys.", "answer_choice": "B"}
